title: Mali demotes French, language of its former colonizer, in symbolic move
description: Mali's new constitution moves French from an official language to a working one. It also strengthens the power of a regime that's distanced itself from France.

title: Two U.S. Navy sailors arrested on charges of passing secrets to China
description: The service members were arrested in California in two separate cases for sending blueprints, operational manuals and details of large-scale military exercises.

title: U.S. moves to put Marines on commercial ships to stop Iranian seizures
description: The plan to embark Marines on commercial oil tankers is a remarkable escalation in the long-running feud between the U.S. and Iran.

title: Ukraine’s offensive inches forward in search of a breakthrough
description: Intense fighting raged in southeastern Ukraine this week as Kyiv continued a major push to reclaim territory with a fresh injection of Western-trained and equipped troops but no sign yet of a major breakthrough.

title: Climate activists drape British prime minister’s home in ‘oil-black’ fabric
description: Greenpeace activists climbed the roof of Rishi Sunak's private Yorkshire manor using ropes and ladders, then draped 2,000 square feet of dark material across one side of the building.

title: Car, knife attack injures 13 in South Korea; police treating as ‘terror act’
description: A man in Seongnam rammed a car into pedestrians, left the vehicle and stabbed people near the Seohyeon subway station, authorities said.

title: A new birther lie? ‘Claudia the Mexican’ fights back.
description: Mexico had largely avoided the birther conspiracy theories and identity politics familiar to Americans — until now.

title: A new birther lie? ‘Claudia the Mexican’ fights back.
description: Mexico had largely avoided the birther conspiracy theories and identity politics familiar to Americans — until now.

title: Australia hires consultant to advise government on its consultants
description: The Australian federal government hired an ethics consultant to advise it on hiring consulting firms after a tax information leak scandal involving PwC.

title: Chinese parents trying to set screen limits get new ally: The government
description: Chinese authorities want to limit even older children to two hours a day on their smartphones. They also want to "spread the core values of socialism."

title: Brazilian police raids leave at least 45 dead in a week
description: Anti-gang crackdowns in Brazil took place across multiple states. Local lawmakers called the shootings a "massacre" and said police make life in favelas "hell."

title: Australia’s National Gallery to return stolen treasures to Cambodia
description: The gallery has concluded that three of its Cham sculptures were probably looted and illegally sold by disgraced art collector Douglas Latchford.

title: Ukraine live briefing: F-16 training to begin this month; nearly 11,000 civilians dead, Kyiv says
description: The Biden administration agreed in May to allow allied nations to send U.S.-made F-16 fighter jets to Kyiv.

title: Anti-LGBTQ backlash grows across Middle East, echoing U.S. culture wars
description: LGBTQ+ communities in the Middle East face a growing crackdown, mirroring efforts by American conservatives to restrict the rights of gay and transgender people.

title: Martin Walser, eminent German writer, dies at 96
description: His trenchant novels about contemporary Germany elevated him to the country’s pantheon of writers who emerged after World War II.

title: How Quran burners got the global attention they wanted
description: Despite their outsize impact, the book burners are not a large group.
